page.title: 15NEWS MEDIA IN CUCKFIELD
page.content: 66% of people interviewed read a national daily newspaper. The least read was the local daily 'Evening Argus' because people prefer to read newspapers in the morning and local news in this paper is mainly about Brighton and other large towns. 33% read the 'Mid Sussex Times', the local weekly printed in nearby Haywards Heath. There are also 3 free advertising newspapers. One half of the people have papers delivered. Nearly every household has a television set. Adults prefer to watch BBC, children ITV. Only 15% of people interviewed listen to local radio: Southern Sound or Radio Sussex both of which are based in Brighton, 17 miles away. Children prefer to listen to BBC Radio 1 whilst Radio 4 is more popular with adults.
